description: From Spanish abacá, from Tagalog abaká.

entries.meaning: Musa textilis, a species of banana tree native to the Philippines grown for its textile, rope- and papermaking fibre. [First attested in the mid 18th century.]
examples: Synonyms: Manila Hemp, Manilla hemp, textile banana

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The fiber of this plant, used in rope, fibers, and cloth[First attested in the mid 18th century.]
